item.description:
Any fans of the bands Cracker and Camper Van Beethoven out there?

Those two bands, both fronted by Dave Lowery, will be making their now traditional mid-winter stop at The Middle East Downstairs on Sunday night, 20 January, 2013.  This is the sixth year that Lowery has done this combined Cracker and CVB show and it's the fourth local stop.

You might remember the quirky CVB song "Take the Skinheads Bowling" or maybe their terrific cover of "Pictures of Matchstick Men".

Cracker's hits included "Low" and "Teen Angst" ... although my favorite has always been "Euro-Trash Girl".

The Middie Down is always a great place to see a show -- loud and raucous -- and with these two bands, it will be a great night of music, so come join us!  (Plus, many of us are off the next day for Martin Luther King Day, yet another reason to stay out late.)

Notes:

  • Get tickets here:

    TicketWeb.  Tickets are $20 in advance, $22 at the door.

  • Doors are at 8:00 p.m.

  • This will be a joint Meetup with these groups:

    Cambridge-Somerville Live Music
    Fun with Alcohol!
    Social Fun
  • It's a Sunday, so street parking is free in Cambridge.
  • The Central Square T Stop is only a couple of blocks away.
  • There are also taxi stands on Mass Ave in Cambridge.
item.how_to_find_us: I look like my profile picture. I'll be hanging at the bar and I'll also email my cell # to all Yes RSVPers on the afternoon of the show.
item.name: Cracker with Camper Van Beethoven
